intro: Xanthophyllum brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Xanthophyllum brevipes is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with hairy leaves that reduce water loss. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
